document_content.title: Referral to Internal Medicine for Further Evaluation

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Elena Brooks presents with persistent fatigue, intermittent low-grade fever, and unintentional weight loss over the past 3 months. Initial workup has been inconclusive, and further evaluation by Internal Medicine is requested.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports feeling increasingly tired for the past 3 months, with difficulty maintaining her usual level of activity. She has noticed a weight loss of approximately 6 kg during this period, despite no intentional dietary changes. She also describes episodes of low-grade fever, mostly in the evenings, without chills or night sweats.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: No known chronic illnesses. No previous hospitalizations or surgeries. No known drug allergies.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Occasional acetaminophen for headaches. No regular medications.

sections.heading: Social History
sections.content: Non-smoker, does not consume alcohol, works as a school administrator. No recent travel or sick contacts.

sections.heading: Family History
sections.content: No family history of autoimmune disease, malignancy, or chronic infections.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vital signs within normal limits. Mild pallor noted. No lymphadenopathy or organomegaly. Cardiovascular, respiratory, and neurological exams unremarkable.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: CBC: mild anemia (Hb 10.8 g/dL), WBC and platelets normal. ESR mildly elevated at 32 mm/hr. Basic metabolic panel and liver function tests within normal limits. Chest X-ray unremarkable.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the nonspecific symptoms and mild laboratory abnormalities, a broader evaluation is requested to rule out infectious, hematologic, or autoimmune etiologies. Kindly assess and advise on further management.
